name: Courtyard by Marriott Clemson

reviews.text: This hotel is by far one of the nicest I've stayed in for a while. The staff is friendly and helpful. The interactive touch display in the lobby is really neat, and can be quite helpful. On the downside, the internet connection is slow and gets bogged down to unusable during peak hours. The cafe is quite good, have enjoyed the oatmeal and coffee. The complementary coffee isn't worth it, pay the $2 for the starbucks! The hot water at the complementary drink area tastes like coffee, so avoid tea. I know I'm just looking to pull out a couple of negatives, but this place is truly a nice place in a nice part of town.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really enjoyed staying at the Clemson Courtyard Marriott. It was very clean and has a great fitness facility. I had read a previous review that the pool was heated, but found that it was not heated at all... and it was way too cold to even think about getting in despite the warm weather. Loved the inviting lounge and outside fire pit. The bed was very comfortable and the only thing that could have been better was the linens were too thin. The air conditioner was too good, but had to watch it because it would get too cold. Loved the flat screen tv that turned to face the bed or couch.. very nice touch. The bathroom was very luxurious with the over-sized shower with seat. The breakfast food at the bistro was good, but had very few selections and seemed kinda pricey..but I did love getting my starbucks coffee in house. This would be an awesome hotel if the pool were indoors or at least heated and they had a free hot breakfast bar. Especially since it was not a cheap stay at $125 a night.
reviews.title: Very Nice but wished there were more

reviews.text: Nice comfortable hotel. A few comments - my wife would have appeciated a makeup mirror outrside the bathroom as three people tring to use the same bathroom area at the same time was awkward. Also, not alll computers are connecte to the printers - something I found out when printing boarding passes for return flight.
reviews.title: College visit

reviews.text: Front desk and restaurant personnel were very friendly
reviews.title: outdoor heated pool!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall though a typical Marriott property with high standards.
reviews.title: What a great surprise!

reviews.text: I did not to expect such a great hotel in Clemson. The employees were extremely courteous and upbeat. I love the decor of the hotel. The lounge area made you feel very comfortable. I loved the small bar. Small enough to buy a drink and relax but not big enough to entice a rowdy crowd. Our room could have been a room in any home. It didn't feel like a hotel room and extremely clean. Will definitely make sure I reserve a room well in advance for my next trip.
reviews.title: Awesome Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Traveled to Clemson for 4 days to watch some sporting events and stayed at the Courtyard by Marriott Clemson. In a word . . . "amazing". The check-in was simple, the rooms was brand new with updated interiors,, the bed as comfortable with 5 pillows, a large shower, sofa and very quiet. I have stayed at luxury hotels and this property ranks up there. I highly recommend this property.
reviews.title: Fantastic Modern Hotel
Great hotel
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel while taking a tour at Clemson. First when you put in the address on the GPS, it does not recognize it because the hotel is so new. Had to call the hotel and get an actual address that is recognized by GPS. The hotel is ver nice. Clean and spacious. The only negative is that it does not offer continental breakfast. It has a restaurant in the lobby but the prices are very pricey. So pricey that I went out and found a McDonalds.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a nice spot to stay - very close to the campus of Clemson. Very new so it was realy clean and spiffy. We were all very pleased with the choice of this hotel.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives: This hotel must be very new. Everything seems fresh. Room was clean. Bed was comfortable. Hotel is not on a main room. No traffic noise! A business center with two computers located in the lobby; plus, an additional computer dedicated to the printing of airline boarding passes is available. There was a small refigerator in the room.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.text: Hotel and surrounding area appear to be an almost new development. Hotel was very clean with good service. Room was big and spotless; my only complaint was that the sink, toilet and tub were all in one room, making it a challenge for everyone to get ready in the morning. Pool was small and cool (unheated?). Breakfast at the bistro the next morning was good.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: in town for a wedding. Hotel was amazingly clean. Clean carpets, no mold or mildew, clean tiles and counters. Everything looked new. Stayed in a 2 room suite w/ 3 kids. lots of room, especially w/ the two sinks and tv's. The only thing I wished they had was a lighted makeup mirror. lighting wasn't great but that's minor compared to how great everything was!
reviews.title: super clean!

reviews.text: Service was great, room was cleaned late in day at our request w/ no problem. Starbucks employee went out of her way to serve us breakfast items after they had closed for the morning.
reviews.title: Immaculate

reviews.text: The staff was okay. I don't think they liked me checking in around 1pm but I wanted a room on a lower level near the elevator and they were nice enough to give that to me. The hotel was immaculate. The parking was kind of tight due to the hotel being almost sold out because of a horse race. Luckly, I was able to get one around 11pm. The parking lot is well lit, in a good location (kinda tucked away). My room was awesome. I had a mini-suite. It was quite comfy and the lay out was much different from other hotels. As you walk in the bed area the bed is positioned facing the window on your left (not against that long wall as you walk in) I liked that. I especially liked the bathroom, all tile. This hotel is ideal for business travelers, not for families
reviews.title: Close to Clemson

reviews.text: Clean, comfortable hotel. Good value. Nice staff. The restaurant was mostly out of food on a Sunday morning due to a busy weekend. Poor planning.
reviews.title: A Nice Stay

description: * Located off of Hwy. 93 and US 123, within a mile of Clemson University * Lobby features an interactive 52" touch screen GoBoard that displays maps, weather, headlines and more * Bistro, Starbucks and full bar; serving breakfast and dinner * The Market offers refreshments and snacks 24/7
